newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Another Seoul firm allowed for N.Korean biz - paper.
newsitem.headline: Another Seoul firm allowed for N.Korean biz - paper.

text.p: South Korea on Thursday gave permission for a leading pharmaceutical company to send officials to North Korea to discuss a plan to invest in the communist state, a leading South Korean newspaper reported.
The Friday edition of the Dong-A Ilbo seen late on Thursday reported the unification ministry gave permission for Korea Green Cross Corp to send three officials to North Korea.
Korea Green Cross plans to invest $3 million in a joint venture with a North Korean firm to produce a thrombosis cure, the newspaper said.
Officials at the unification ministry and the company were not immediately available for comment.
The approval came less than a week after Taechang Co was given the go-ahead to invest $5.8 million in a project to bottle mineral water in North Korea.
Along with Taechang, four other companies including LG Electronics Inc and Hanwha Corp were also given approval last Friday to do business in the North.
South and North Korea have been technically at war since their 1950-53 war ended in a truce.
